title: Submit - Usage Examples
description: Common usage patterns and example configurations for form submit buttons

examples.name: Simple Submit Button (Center Aligned)
examples.description: Basic submit button with center alignment, no icon
examples.visualDescription: Standard submit button labeled 'Send Message', centered below form fields, inherits parent styling (color, background, padding, border)
examples.useCase: Contact forms, registration forms, simple submissions
notes: btnAlign='center' centers button in container
All styling (color, background, hover states) controlled by parent tp-form-block
Default button type is 'none' (no icon)
Button displays as block-level element (full-width container)

examples.name: Submit Button with Icon (Before Text)
examples.description: Submit button with paper plane icon positioned before text
examples.visualDescription: Submit button with purple paper plane icon on left, white text 'Subscribe' on right, purple background, 20px icon size
examples.useCase: Newsletter signups, email subscriptions, send actions
notes: ButtonType must be 'fontAwesome' for FontAwesome icons
ButtonIcon uses Font Awesome class (fas fa-paper-plane, fas fa-check, etc.)
iconPos='-1' places icon before text (use '1' for after text)
Icon color changes on hover with hvrIcnClr
Responsive icon size (20px desktop, 18px tablet, 16px mobile)

examples.name: Submit Button with Icon (After Text)
examples.description: Submit button with arrow right icon positioned after text
examples.visualDescription: Submit button with white text 'Continue' on left, purple arrow icon on right, centered, icon transitions on hover
examples.useCase: Multi-step forms, continue actions, next page buttons
notes: iconPos='1' places icon after text (right side)
iconSpc controls gap between text and icon (10px)
Useful for 'next' or 'continue' actions (icon points right)
Icon size slightly smaller (18px) for subtle appearance

examples.name: Submit Button with Custom Image Icon
examples.description: Submit button using custom image icon instead of font icon
examples.visualDescription: Submit button with custom send icon image (24x24px) before text 'Submit Form', centered alignment
examples.useCase: Branded forms, custom-designed forms, theme-specific submit buttons
notes: ButtonType must be 'image' for custom images
ButtonImage.url should be full URL to image file
ButtonImage.Id is WordPress media library ID
Recommended image size: 24x24px or 32x32px
Image icons don't support color customization (use SVG for color control)

examples.name: Inline Submit Button for Newsletter
examples.description: Inline submit button optimized to sit on same row as email field
examples.visualDescription: Compact submit button labeled 'Join', purple background, arrow icon, 120px width, sits inline with email field
examples.useCase: Newsletter signups, footer email collection, hero section CTAs with email field
notes: isInline=true enables inline button mode (nxt-btn-inline class)
btnSz sets button width (120px desktop, 100px tablet/mobile)
Email field should have inpSz ~68-70% to leave room for button
Button stacks below email on mobile for better UX
Parent tp-form-block layoutType should support inline (nxt-newsstyle-1, nxt-newsstyle-3, nxt-newsstyle-4)
btnAlign='left' aligns button left (inline with email field)

examples.name: Full-Width Submit Button
examples.description: Full-width submit button spanning entire form width
examples.visualDescription: Large submit button spanning full form width, labeled 'Create Account', check circle icon, centered text, white text on purple gradient
examples.useCase: Registration forms, account creation, prominent CTAs
notes: btnSz with unit '%' and value '100' makes button full-width
btnAlign='center' centers text within full-width button
Check circle icon reinforces positive action (account creation)
Full-width buttons are prominent and mobile-friendly

examples.name: Submit Button with Custom Sizing and Spacing
examples.description: Submit button with custom min-width and icon spacing
examples.visualDescription: Medium-sized submit button (180px wide), labeled 'Get Started', rocket icon, 15px gap between icon and text, right-aligned
examples.useCase: Landing pages, CTAs, custom form layouts requiring specific button sizing
notes: btnSz controls minimum button width (180px desktop, 160px tablet, 100% mobile)
iconSpc controls gap between icon and text (15px)
btnAlign='right' aligns button to right side of form
Rocket icon suggests launch/start action
Hover icon color changes to yellow (#ffe066) for emphasis

examples.name: Professional Submit Button with All Features
examples.description: Comprehensive submit button with icon, responsive sizing, custom spacing, hover states
examples.visualDescription: Purple submit button labeled 'Submit Application', purple ID card icon on left (changes to lighter purple on hover), 200px wide, 12px icon gap, centered, responsive sizing
examples.useCase: Professional applications, job submissions, high-value forms
notes: Combines icon, responsive sizing, custom spacing, and hover states
ID card icon reinforces professional/application context
Fully responsive: 220px desktop, 180px tablet, full-width mobile
Icon size and spacing also responsive for optimal appearance on all devices
Hover icon color changes subtly (#ffffff ‚Üí #e0e0ff)

validationRules.labelss: Required - Button label text displayed to user
validationRules.ButtonIcon: Required if ButtonType='fontAwesome' - Font Awesome class
validationRules.ButtonImage: Required if ButtonType='image' - Object with url and Id
validationRules.btnSz: Optional - Responsive min-width object (default: empty, inherits parent)
validationRules.isInline: Optional - Set true for inline button mode (default: false)
validationRules.parentFormId: Optional - Parent form ID (auto-set by system)

warnings: ‚ö†Ô∏è PARENT REQUIRED: nxt-submit-button MUST be placed inside tp-form-block (ancestor requirement)
‚ö†Ô∏è ICON TYPE: ButtonType must be set before ButtonIcon or ButtonImage will work
‚ö†Ô∏è INLINE BUTTON: isInline=true requires sibling email/name field with reduced width (~68-70%)
‚ö†Ô∏è BUTTON SIZING: btnSz with unit='%' and value='100' makes button full-width
‚ö†Ô∏è ICON POSITION: iconPos='-1' places icon before text, '1' places after text
‚ö†Ô∏è ICON SPACING: iconSpc controls gap between icon and text (use 8-15px typically)
‚ö†Ô∏è STYLING: Button color, background, padding, border controlled by parent tp-form-block (btnClr, btnBgClr, etc.)
‚ö†Ô∏è ICON COLOR: icnClr and hvrIcnClr only work with ButtonType='fontAwesome', not with image icons
‚ö†Ô∏è IMAGE ICON SIZE: Custom image icons should be 24x24px or 32x32px for optimal display
‚ö†Ô∏è ALIGNMENT: btnAlign controls button alignment in container ('left', 'center', 'right')
‚ö†Ô∏è RESPONSIVE: Always set mobile (xs) btnSz to small value or 100% for better UX
‚ö†Ô∏è INLINE MODE: Parent tp-form-block layoutType must support inline buttons (nxt-newsstyle-1, nxt-newsstyle-3, nxt-newsstyle-4)
commonMistakes: ‚ùå Forgetting to set ButtonType before adding icon (icons won't appear)
‚ùå Using isInline=true without reducing sibling field width (button wraps to new line)
‚ùå Setting btnSz without unit (must include unit: 'px' or '%')
‚ùå Using iconPos='0' (use '-1' for before, '1' for after)
‚ùå Expecting icon color change with image icons (only works with fontAwesome)
‚ùå Using btnAlign on inline buttons (alignment controlled by form layout in inline mode)
‚ùå Not testing responsive widths on mobile (buttons should adapt or go full-width on xs)
‚ùå Using vague button labels like 'Submit' instead of specific 'Send Message' or 'Create Account'
‚ùå Placing submit button outside tp-form-block parent (block won't render correctly)
‚ùå Using iconSpc without iconSz (no effect if icon doesn't exist)
‚ùå Setting btnSz to very small values (< 80px) making button too cramped
bestPractices: ‚úÖ Use descriptive button labels: 'Send Message' not 'Submit', 'Create Account' not 'Continue'
‚úÖ Choose icons that match action: fa-paper-plane for send, fa-check for submit, fa-arrow-right for continue
‚úÖ Set btnAlign='center' for most forms (centered buttons look balanced)
‚úÖ Use btnAlign='left' for inline buttons (matches email field alignment)
‚úÖ Set btnSz to 180-220px for desktop (comfortable click target), full-width on mobile
‚úÖ Use iconPos='-1' (icon before text) for most cases, '1' for directional actions (next/continue)
‚úÖ Set iconSz to 18-24px for good balance with text size
‚úÖ Use iconSpc of 10-15px for comfortable icon-text gap
‚úÖ Provide hover icon color (hvrIcnClr) for visual feedback
‚úÖ For inline buttons, set isInline=true AND btnSz ~120-150px
‚úÖ Use full-width buttons (btnSz=100%) for mobile-first designs
‚úÖ Test button with long labels (internationalization) - ensure btnSz accommodates
‚úÖ Use consistent icon style across form (if email has icon, submit should too)
‚úÖ For newsletter forms, use short labels ('Join', 'Subscribe', '‚Üí') in inline mode
‚úÖ Set responsive btnSz, iconSz, iconSpc for optimal appearance on all devices
‚úÖ Use white icon color (#ffffff) on colored button backgrounds for contrast

accessibilityNotes: üåê WCAG 2.1 AA Compliance:
- Button label must be descriptive (labelss attribute): 'Send Message' not 'Click Here'
- Button must have sufficient contrast with background (4.5:1 for text, 3:1 for focus)
- Icon is decorative and supplemental to text label
- Button must be keyboard accessible (Enter/Space to activate)
üéØ Focus States:
- Parent tp-form-block controls focus styling (actInpBg, actInpBdr)
- Ensure focus state has 3:1 contrast ratio with background
- Focus indicator must be visible and obvious
‚å®Ô∏è Keyboard Navigation:
- Tab key moves to submit button
- Enter or Space activates button (submits form)
- Focus order: fields ‚Üí submit button (logical flow)
üîä Screen Reader Considerations:
- Label announced: 'Send Message, button'
- Icon not announced (decorative only, aria-hidden=true)
- Button role automatically recognized by screen readers
- Loading state should announce 'Submitting...' if implemented
üåà Color Contrast:
- Button text must have 4.5:1 contrast with button background
- Icon color (icnClr) should have 3:1 contrast with button background
- Hover state must maintain contrast ratios
- Focus indicator must have 3:1 contrast with adjacent colors
üñ±Ô∏è Click Target Size:
- Minimum 44x44px click target (WCAG 2.1 Level AAA)
- Use btnSz min 120px width, min 44px height (set in parent tp-form-block btnPad)
- Larger targets (180-220px) recommended for better usability
üì± Mobile Accessibility:
- Full-width buttons (100%) on mobile for easy tapping
- Minimum 44px height maintained on all breakpoints
- Adequate spacing between button and fields above (parent rowGap)

parentChildRelationship.requirement: CRITICAL - nxt-submit-button MUST be inside tp-form-block
parentControls: Button background (btnBgClr, hvrBtnBgClr) - background and hover background
Button typography (btnTypo) - font size, weight, family
Button border (btnBdr, btnBdrRds) - border and border radius
childControls: Icon (ButtonType, ButtonIcon, ButtonImage, iconPos, iconSz, iconSpc, icnClr, hvrIcnClr)
workflow: 2. Set parent styling (button color, background, padding, border)
3. Add form fields (name, email, phone, etc.)
4. Add nxt-submit-button child as last block in form
5. Configure child-specific settings (label, icon, alignment, size)
6. Button triggers parent form submission on click
submissionFlow: 2. Form validates all fields (reqTgl, patt, etc.)
3. If validation fails: error messages shown, no submission
4. If validation passes: loading state shown, form data collected
5. Form data sent to parent-configured action (Email, Mailchimp, etc.)
6. Success/error message shown based on result
7. Form optionally resets or remains filled

buttonLabelGuide.description: Best practices for button labels (labelss attribute)
principles: Match context: 'Apply Now' for job forms, 'Subscribe' for newsletters
internationalization: Keep labels short for translation (long German/Finnish words may overflow)
Test button with 2x-3x label length to ensure btnSz accommodates
Consider icon-only buttons for very compact layouts (with aria-label)
